intro: Polygala oxyptera f. ciliata, commonly known as the ciliate milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Polygalaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers. The leaves are typically narrow and slightly hairy, while the flowers are usually pale yellow or greenish-white. This species thrives in arid or semi-arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. It plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators and serving as a host plant for certain insects.
